THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS
AUSTIN 12
OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT
MAIN UNIVERSITY
October 29, 1952
Mr. Graydon Ausmus, Vice-President
National Association of
Educational Broadcasters
P. 0. Box 2002
University, Alabama
Dear Mr. Ausmus:
Your inquiry concerning Mr. Gale Adkins arrived
several days ago, but this is my first opportunity
to reply. It is a fine compliment to Mr. Adkins
that you are considering him for the important
position of Executive Director of the National
Association of Educational Broadcasters. However,
I am confident that it would handicap our program
here rather seriously if he should leave prior to
the end of the current long session, as he is
presently serving as Acting Director of Radio House.
Mr. Adkins has been connected with Radio House for
a period of at least eight years, and in my judgment
he has rendered excellent service. However, I have
not been associated closely enough with our radio
work to enable me to give you an accurate appraisal
of his technical competence. Accordingly, I am
referring your letter to Professor T. A. Rousse,
Chairman of our Radio Committee, with the request
that he give you his professional appraisal of Mr.
Adkinâ€™s abilities. I am confident that you will
hear from Professor Rousse within the near future.
With best personal wishes, I am
Sincerely yours.
JCD:bg
James C. Dolley
Acting President
Main University
cc: Professor T. A. Rousse
